reviews.text: 2049 is able to exist both as a masterful sequel and/or stand-alone film in the universe, which showcases Villeneuve’s massive skill as a storyteller and further validates him as one of the best visionaries of our generation.
reviews.author: Brittany Patrice Witherspoon

reviews.text: If the original film’s warmth beneath the cold metropolitan’s structure came from Deckard’s love for Rachel, 2049 extends this ethos to a love and understanding of the self in the greater context of others.
reviews.author: Justin Micallef

reviews.text: Just as in the original, this film is as much about the texture of the world on screen as it is the story of the Replicants 30 years after Deckard first strolled the mean streets of L.A.
reviews.author: Sean Axmaker

reviews.text: Much like its predecessor, 2049 is a methodically structured puzzle, solved through slow but persistent drips of revelation.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: That Villeneuve achieves such a cerebral and even touching picture, while also accomplishing an uncommonly sublime production, marks Blade Runner 2049 as a landmark in the science-fiction genre.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: It's immaculately constructed, full of true wonder, and keeps you under its spell all the way to the very end. In some ways, Blade Runner 2049 even surpasses the original.
reviews.author: Drew Dietsch

reviews.text: Heady science-fiction fans, this episode is for you.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: A new chapter. A triumph. A cinematic miracle.
reviews.author: Olly Richards

reviews.text: Unlike the original film, where the "romance" feels like a product of Deckard's dehumanized relationship with Replicants, the romance between Ryan Gosling's K and Ana de Armas' Joi, both machines, feels real and keeps the film intriguing.
reviews.author: Ian Brill

reviews.text: A skilfully made movie that works as a companion piece to Scott's film and as a detective mystery.
reviews.author: Richard Crouse

reviews.text: Deliberate in its pacing and world-building, the follow-up to Ridley Scott's dystopian vision of Los Angeles uses breathtaking cinematography, impeccable production, and a gripping story to make our second visit even more revelatory than the first.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Zhang

reviews.text: Slow-burn thrillers don't always work, particularly when fused with science-fiction and brief action, but here the finale is a welcome redemption.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a visual feast for the eyes that demands to be seen in theaters.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: A rather remarkable sequel.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is so visually poetic yet intelligently profound that it leaves a haunting linger if you've engaged with its concept enough.
reviews.author: Kelechi Ehenulo

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 can be aggravatingly sparse and sometimes bombastic, taking too much time to say what it wants to. When the pieces fall into place, however, it's spellbinding.
reviews.author: Matt Cipolla

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a deep, technically impeccable film that manages to expand the story of its predecessor, pushing it to new heights. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ricardo Gallegos

reviews.text: The reason Blade Runner 2049 will be remembered, just like its predecessor, is for its visuals. My God, the visuals.
reviews.author: CJ Sheu

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 just might be the greatest sequel since The Godfather: Part II.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is distilled science fiction, as intriguing and profound as the predecessor. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: Fills the screen with breathtaking visuals that are worthy of repeat viewings, presents ideas that will have you contemplating big-picture concepts for days after you see it, and provides a stage for stellar performances from Gosling on down.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: Everything fit together... I was a fan.
reviews.author: Avaryl Halley

reviews.text: This is an art piece.
reviews.author: Andrew Galdi

reviews.text: The film's running time is hefty, but its pleasures are deep and satisfying. Villeneuve's direction is brilliant, and if Deakins doesn't win an Oscar for this cinematography, the award has no meaning. See it on the largest screen you can find.
reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is one of the best sci-fi films I've seen in a long time, and certainly the equal to the first film.
reviews.author: Leslie Combemale

reviews.text: Echoing a bygone era of studio films daring to push boundaries and expectations rather than demurely adhering to them, Blade Runner 2049 is every bit a soliloquy of dread in response to Scott's ballet of violence.
reviews.author: Nicholas Bell

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 refines Blade Runner's themes and widens its scope with such immaculate skill and savvy calculation that, ironically, I don't think it could have nearly the same impact as Blade Runner did
reviews.author: Rhys Tarling

reviews.text: Love the sets and trappings, especially of the nightclub with stars from yesteryear, but the film itself is not satisfying and way too long.
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 was totally not what I expected. Yes, bits of it are dumb. But bits of it are very good, and some bits of it are positively awesome.
reviews.author: Ard Vijn

reviews.text: The fact this story is so ridiculously nourishing while still leaving me pondering some really big questions will remain one of cinemas great mysteries.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a visual masterpiece, but a drudging descent for the sci-fi genre.
reviews.author: Chris Sawin

reviews.text: A masterpiece pure and simple, Blade Runner 2049 does not disappoint and will keep hardcore fans and newcomers alike equally happy with what they're seeing.
reviews.author: Josh Wilding

reviews.text: The journey...is slow, deliberate, and well thought out, spending most of its time on drawing questions out of the audience than making an action-filled juggernaut. [February 1, 2018]
reviews.author: Luke Parker

reviews.text: BLADE RUNNER 2049 certainly looks the part but beyond the surface it is nothing more than a pale replicant of the real thing.
reviews.author: Alex Maidy

reviews.text: Its aesthetic is so outstanding that you can spend 160 minutes nailed to the chair. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Juan Luis Caviaro

reviews.text: To call Blade Runner 2049 a satisfying experience would be an understatement.
reviews.author: Karl Delossantos

reviews.text: A film that is thematically complex and visually astounding.
reviews.author: Tyler Smith

reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: By syncing so many moving parts into a seamless, spellbinding whole, Blade Runner 2049 is both heady speculative fiction and action thriller at its finest.
reviews.author: Josh Goller

reviews.text: All told, this feels like the best-case scenario for a sequel three-plus decades in the making: it is a glorious visual evolution of its predecessor that retains only the tones and themes it needs.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: It does the unthinkable: takes one of the most popular cult films of all time and actually makes a sequel worthy of its name.
reviews.author: Grant Watson

reviews.text: Villeneuve wisely takes the themes of Scott's Blade Runner and explores them from a new angle, while maintaining fidelity to the world built by its now classic predecessor.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.author: Andrew Kendall

reviews.text: One of the most amazing things about Blade Runner 2049 is that is manages to capture the spirit and style of the original, while also feeling completely new.
reviews.author: Marianna Neal

reviews.author: Cate Marquis

reviews.text: I want to live inside Blade Runner 2049.
reviews.author: Richard Trenholm

reviews.text: Thirty-five years was not too long to wait for a sequel of this calibre.
reviews.author: Rachael Mead

reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: Direction may be classical - restrained and elegantly composed - but his visuals are from another world.
reviews.author: Tom Bond

reviews.text: It's unlikely that Blade Runner 2049 will reach the cult status Scott's original film developed, though Villeneuve's effort is a labour of love that certainly deserves its due.
reviews.author: Deborah Cornelious

reviews.text: After all this time there are now two Blade Runner films, and they're both great. What a weird world we live in!
reviews.author: David Hogan

reviews.text: [Blade Runner 2049] is a visually stunning and beautifully made expansion of a fascinating world.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.author: Emmanuel Noisette

reviews.text: A stone-cold masterpiece.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: This is as challenging a blockbuster as has been made in the modern era, and it's all the better for it.
reviews.author: Kyle Pinion

reviews.text: An expansive and inspiring followup to the Ridley Scott classic. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Fernando Galván

reviews.text: Welcome proof that returning to and expanding on a cherished story can still produce invigorating cinema that lives up to the ambition and artistry of the original.
reviews.author: Andrew Wyatt

reviews.text: A perfect follow-up film that expands the themes of its predecessor for a new century.
reviews.author: Evan Dossey

reviews.text: While it doesn't quite meet the heightened expectations, it's runs on plenty of nostalgia, twists and visuals.
reviews.author: Nathalia Aryani

reviews.author: Ciaran Kerr

reviews.author: Julia Swift

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is filled with an unparalleled artistry and is among one of the best looking movies ever to come out of Hollywood.
reviews.author: Louisa Moore

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is an upgrade in most departments and is an utter joy to watch.
reviews.author: Matt Hudson

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a beautiful, visually stunning film that captures philosophical themes and everything that made 1982's Blade Runner so special.
reviews.author: Sheraz Farooqi

reviews.text: For fans of the original, this beautiful masterwork extends the legacy ... Fans of films that are thought-provoking and lingering in both shot and effect, it's a must-see.
reviews.author: Colby Bryant

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve flawlessly builds on the surrealism, mystery, and intrigue that made the original Blade Runner a cult classic.
reviews.author: Kent Garrison

reviews.text: Women are aggressively objectified for the male gaze, while people of color are simply erased.
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: In the end, Villeneuve's allusion to Nabokov confesses the derivative status of his sequel...
reviews.author: Namwali Serpell

reviews.text: Luckily, thanks to Denis Villeneuve's deft direction and an intelligent story, Blade Runner 2049 is not only a worthy sequel, it's an expansion and evolution of the mythology and themes.
reviews.author: Michelle Kisner

reviews.author: Frank Ochieng

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a movie drenched in frills, crafted with a discerning eye and a work of art that will be long debated years from now.
reviews.author: Matt Ward

reviews.text: With a style so simultaneously reverent of the past and boundary pushing today, the genius of craft behind Blade Runner 2049 truly is its greatest asset.
reviews.author: Ed Travis

reviews.text: Villeneuve has undeniably achieved something grand, making a sequel with insurmountable worth in its own right.
reviews.author: Matt Oakes

reviews.text: Villeneuve's masterpiece is an impeccably realised, extraordinary sci-fi neo-noir that will be noted as one of the greatest ever blockbusters.
reviews.author: Cameron Frew

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a worthy successor to the original film, avoiding the mistakes of other recent revivals and bringing just enough new to the table.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: ...lays out entirely new waves of questions that will be chewed on and puzzled over in the years and decades to come, assuring that it doesn't just fade away like tears in the rain.
reviews.author: Zaki Hasan

reviews.text: I don't know that it's a "masterpiece" on par with the first one, but it's an entirely solid science fiction feature in its own right with a lot of intriguing ideas at its core.
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.author: Sean Mulvihill

reviews.author: Johnny Gayzmonic

reviews.text: Much like the 1982 original, this is a visual marvel - with director Denis Villeneuve meticulously crafting this futuristic world in great detail - although the narrative lacks the same spark.
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: Any follow-up to Ridley Scott's Blade Runner was going to be an uphill struggle.
reviews.author: Niall Browne

reviews.text: In its first try, Blade Runner 2049 is the movie [Ridley] Scott wanted and audiences have deserved for more than three decades.
reviews.author: Matt Miller

reviews.text: A perfect sequel and, arguably, film in recent memory.
reviews.author: Nguyên Lê

reviews.author: Tomas Trussow

reviews.text: Perhaps Blade Runner 2049's biggest flaw is style over substance. Check it out for the beautiful look, but be careful diving below the surface.
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: It's a stunning movie, it's epic, with an epic soundtrack.
reviews.author: Achara Kirk

reviews.text: Villeneuve is easily up there with my favorite directors now.
reviews.author: Jaby Koay

reviews.text: It's a movie with large spaces that gives us room, both physically and temporally, to let experiences sink in, to enjoy character moments, to worry about danger, and to appreciate nods (large and small) to the earlier film.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: ... it's great to see a director and his crew being given the freedom to be eccentric, contemplative, and create a film that doesn't leave you when you exit the dark hall.
reviews.author: Akhil Arora

reviews.text: Wallace's desire and K's secret are, of course, connected, because in this gorgeous new Blade Runner, the narrative slots neatly together in a way that's tidy but unsatisfying.
reviews.author: Molly Templeton

reviews.text: Directed by Arrival maestro Denis Villeneuve, Blade Runner 2049 is a film that, like all of us-human and replicant alike- actively wrestles with its own existence.
reviews.author: Adam Epstein

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is all experience, sound and rain, but that may be fitting for an age defined by artificial living, electric dreams and lonely desires.
reviews.author: Alci Rengifo

reviews.text: Find you an android lover, curl up to a nice movie.
reviews.author: Tony Baker

reviews.text: It is a startling reminder that even in today's cinema, where CGI spectacles are commonplace, big budget films can produce remarkable works of art.
reviews.author: Joseph Walsh

reviews.text: Sadly, although the film has all the markings of a great sequel, it lacks any passion or sentiment for most of the story.
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: Look elsewhere for your fix, action junkies, and don't judge "2049" for what it isn't.
reviews.author: Rubén Rosario

reviews.text: Small miracles do exist in Blade Runner 2049, but the organic beauty and possibility they represent gets buried beneath ponderous ruminations and plot twists ripped from the pantheon of generic science fiction.
reviews.author: Glenn Heath Jr.

reviews.text: The failure of "Blade Runner 2049" is how it discriminates between men and women, and how that discrimination surpasses the distinction between human and machine. That failure leaves you with no hope for the future.
reviews.author: Sarah Manvel

reviews.text: As remakes, sequels and reboots continue to plague the art form, it's a pleasure to find one that feels like a labour of love. It's a sincere, interesting and compelling film.
reviews.author: Damian Levy

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve, the director of Arrival (2016) and Sicario (2015) is undoubtedly an extraordinary storyteller, and the multidimensional tale of the new Blade Runner is no exception. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Laura Hiros

reviews.text: Gen X was the original audience for Blade Runner, but this film is an insult to it, or maybe just an unnecessary recapitulation of how things are for that generation.
reviews.author: A.S. Hamrah

reviews.text: If every new film made today is to a greater or lesser degree an echo box of past possibilities, what's notable is how much Villeneuve gives those echoes room to breathe and to be new.
reviews.author: Jonathan Romney

reviews.text: It's a very self aware continuation, but not a complete replicant.
reviews.author: Amelia Navascues

reviews.text: This movie is visually stunning. It is so beautiful. Every single shot in this movie feels like a work of art.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: [VIDEO ESSAY] All spectacle and no substance describes Denis Villeneuve's predictably overwrought yet lightweight sci-fi snoozefest.
reviews.author: Cole Smithey

reviews.text: Like its predecessor, Blade Runner 2049 is often difficult to enjoy as traditional entertainment yet impossible not to marvel at. And its merit will no doubt be debated for years to come.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: With it now reaching home media, it's time to ask: is it really that good? In brief: yes.
reviews.author: Kieron Moore

reviews.text: It was a proper Blade Runner sequel...it did everything it needed to do, which was expand on the universe and tell a story that felt like it had to be told.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: Ravishing visuals, expansive worlds, performances that range from compelling to stunning.
reviews.author: Joe Reid

reviews.text: So visually beautiful, I didn't even care what I was watching.
reviews.author: Steph Cozza

reviews.text: Blade Runner fans will love every minute of this homage and its richly imagined futuristic world, but younger viewers who are more into Gosling than they are sci-fi will find the beginning slow-going. . . .
reviews.author: James Plath

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 boasts impeccable direction and marvelous camerawork, on top of astonishing production design, visual effects, and music. However, when it comes to the film's thinly-stretched story, it leaves something to be desired.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: ... complements the narrative arcs of its predecessor... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Uriel Barco

reviews.text: It seems designed to watch itself even if no one showed up, like a rotating hall of mirrors. The film doesn't need us.
reviews.author: Scout Tafoya

reviews.text: ... a logical follow-up to Villeneuve's moody, thoughtful sci-fi work Arrival.
reviews.author: Al Hoff

reviews.author: Erik Henriksen

reviews.text: "Blade Runner 2049," like most sequels, feels hollow compared with the original. That said, it's still visually masterful and worth watching.
reviews.author: Loren King

reviews.text: It's an arresting blend of artistic and blockbuster sensibilities that will stand the test of time right beside its trailblazing predecessor
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: Villeneuve sets a bar for sci-fi sequels.
reviews.author: Matt Patches

reviews.text: If you want to bask in a stylistic expression of the introspective search for self, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.author: Alachia Queen

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is an intelligent iteration, 35 years in the making.
reviews.author: Eli Glasner

reviews.text: Boring with spasms of viciousness: whee.
reviews.author: Gregory Weinkauf

reviews.text: A visually-striking yet often ineffective sequel...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is one of those rare times when a sequel to a classic nails it.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: My immediate wish was for a shorter, more exciting film.
reviews.author: Paul Chambers

reviews.text: Do sci-fi fans dream of immersive future worlds, neon visuals scored by dark synth notes, and existential musings on what it means to be human? Yes, and they dream of Blade Runner 2049.
reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.text: It is richer in ideas than is the original film, though it lacks the iconic visuals of that first film did so well.
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: This awe-inducing spectacle not only follows up on some major lingering questions, but also marinates longer on the original's heady concepts and gift for world-building.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: Sequels will come and go, and it might be some time before Hollywood throws this much money and this much prestige at a franchise staple like this. But at least we have this movie for now.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: Stunning visuals and potent storytelling combine for one stirring sci-fi thriller.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: In the end, for all its pleasures, it's difficult to view Blade Runner 2049 as anything but an elaborate echo of the original, neither true sequel nor reboot, unclear of its own identity.

reviews.text: This movie is obsessed with the idea of women, and I don't mean that in a good way.
reviews.author: Lauren Jernigan

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is director Dennis Villeneuve's best film yet. It's an audio-visual masterclass that will be best experienced in IMAX.

reviews.text: A terrific sequel to an iconic film.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve a hives a perfect balance between style and emotion. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.author: Juanma Fernández París

reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: Why do producers spend millions on stars and special effects and forget to hire writers?

reviews.text: A masterful progression from the original film.

reviews.text: Extends and deepens the 1982 original sci-fi noir, expanding on the apocalyptic cyberpunk vision and further exploring fundamental questions about what defines humanity.

reviews.text: In the midst of its bleak dystopian vision, I found Blade Runner 2049's affirmation of the value of individual life to be surprisingly hopeful.
reviews.author: Joel Mayward

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve has created a modern work of art.

reviews.text: A masterpiece that expands the strength of a classic film. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: It's a story about fathers and children, about memories and war. But it's the love story - problematic sexual politics and all - that feels so real.
reviews.author: Rochelle Siemienowicz

reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: I found this new project to be vastly superior in story, acting, score and overall production.
reviews.author: Danny Minton

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve's sequel to Ridley Scott's 1982 science-fiction classic is very much the French-Canadian filmmaker's own work, building and maintaining a tension through the individual confronting an uncertain environment.

reviews.text: I really, really liked looking at this.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: For all the admirable world-building and faithfulness to the style of the original, the story is almost a let-down and the soporific pace of the film makes it a tough slog.
reviews.author: Tim Martain

reviews.text: Two valid readings of the relationship between Joi and K instantaneously begin when she lights a drag of his smoke, and within that paradox is the heart of the entire Blade Runner universe.

reviews.text: It is a studied and intelligent sequel that feels natural, but best of all it feels necessary, which is a mighty feat for a belated sequel.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: In the hands of a director at the top of his game, Blade Runner 2049 is a blockbuster with brains, heart and an abundance of style, that will certainly reward repeat viewings.
reviews.author: Alistair Ryder

reviews.text: This imperfect, messy, but energetic film deserves to be seen without any knowledge of the plot. The less you know, the better.
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is made with great care, creating a close balance between the homage and a unique story, capable of moving and fascinating us almost as much as the classic from which it takes its name. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Díaz Reyes

reviews.text: Villeneuve is a director of obvious ideas whose edition tends to spell as if the audience could not add two plus two. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Krauze

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve's Blade Runner 2049 is everything you want it to be and nothing you don't.
reviews.author: Bradley Gibson

reviews.text: ... a big-budget genre movie that respects its audience's intelligence, and an homage that adds something beautifully new.
reviews.author: Margot Harrison

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 safely derives from the ancestral roots of Ridley Scott's iconic visionary opus without compromising its value in any way.
reviews.author: Michael Lee

reviews.text: It's great to see [Harrison] Ford revisiting one of his signature roles. His testy, cynical Deckard plays well against [Ryan] Gosling's smooth aplomb as they become unexpected allies in pursuit of the truth.
reviews.author: Lisa Jensen

reviews.text: 2049 goes back to the near future and questions humanity itself.
reviews.author: Brooke Corso

reviews.text: Ultimately, you may find "Blade Runner 2049" something of a replicant itself. It looks right. It sounds right. It may even have some vestige of a soul.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: This is a stunning film that somehow makes you homesick for the original.
reviews.author: Lili Loofbourow

reviews.text: Visually striking and surreal, consistently emphasizing the gritty style/production design over the slow-paced story. But it could earn cinematographer Roger A. Deakins his 14th Oscar nomination and first Academy Award win.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: There is no question that "Blade Runner 2049" is intelligent, very impressive and often even moving. But it doesn't have the philosophical and theoretical depth of the original.
reviews.author: Uri Klein

reviews.text: Villeneuve enters into a kind of cryptogram governed by the precepts of Jacques Lacan on the subversion of the subject and the dialectic of desire. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alberto Sáez Villarino

reviews.text: On its own merits, Blade Runner 2049 is a very strong film; as a sequel, it's nothing short of brilliant.
reviews.author: Max Weiss

reviews.text: Ryan Gosling seems born for this hybrid role. His general monotone detachment works especially well here, and the subtle nuances he shows fits perfectly into the world first etched by Harrison Ford.
reviews.author: Keeva Stratton

reviews.text: Several actors in supporting roles give superb performances...
reviews.author: Diane Carson

reviews.text: Not only is Blade Runner 2049 a worthy sequel, you could make the case that it's better than the original.
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: Time will tell if it's a masterpiece, but at the very least, Blade Runner 2049 is a worthy successor to a groundbreaking film.
reviews.author: Sarah Marrs

reviews.text: Someday on Blu-ray it will be the go-to movie for the attuned to float around in for almost three hours, getting stoned on the bitter and doom-laden toxic mood.
reviews.author: Rob Gonsalves

reviews.text: The 163-minute show drags a bit in the last act, but aside from that - and the danger that techies may view it as a documentary - Villeneuve's remake is the slickest fantasy in many moons.
reviews.author: Kelly Vance

reviews.text: A film that with no waste and is very enjoyable. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Lucero Calderón

reviews.text: Watching Ford and Gosling onscreen together suggests an evolution of masculinity within the films, one that exists along a continuum of noir leading men, from those failing to hide their tenderhearted nature to the solemn figures who make stoicism an art.
reviews.author: Angelica Jade Bastién

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is the perfect example of a sequel done right.
reviews.author: Marija Djurovic

reviews.text: This is a rare sequel that enhances, arguably even surpasses, the mastery of its original. Harrison Ford dubbed it 'a cathedral' of a movie and he's right - this is one to worship.
reviews.author: Larushka Ivan-Zadeh

reviews.text: Though Villeneuve has brilliantly continued the technological and commercial world of Blade Runner, he cleared a lot of clutter. So the urbanist in me was disappointed by 2049. But will Blade Runner 2049 be worth it to the rest of you? Visually, yes.
reviews.author: Charles Mudede

reviews.text: Worthy of the title 'Blade Runner' for the imagery alone, and worth your time even if the central conceit is somehow both convoluted and repetitive. See it on the biggest screen you can.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: ... a quiet movie that never avoids certainties and very good action sequences. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: William Venegas

reviews.text: At 163 minutes, the film has a lot of room, and a lot of plot to fill it with, but the first 100 minutes are largely taken up with detective movie boilerplate.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: It's probably going to take another viewing to fully appreciate Blade Runner 2049. My gut reaction is it's a great movie bordering on masterpiece.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: An innovative film at a narrative and visual level and at the same time, as original as the prequel. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Iván Belmont

reviews.text: The sequel forges its own identity as a new and intriguing incursion into the metaphysical limits of science fiction. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Benjamín Harguindey

reviews.text: An intellectually and emotionally satisfying film. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: A beautiful sequel that needs no comparison. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Nicolás Ruiz

reviews.text: The creators of this film had to use old ingredients to reconstruct a rancid and insipid concept that even Ryan Gosling can't save. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Lara

reviews.text: A valuable balance between the old and the new: it's loyal and at times faithful to Scott's film, and rather than an update, is an extension and an appropriation. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Hugo Hernández Valdivia

reviews.text: A very well acted film, where everything flows naturally making it complex and complete. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Bernal

reviews.text: In its well-intentioned efforts to somehow match the impact of the original, this is a film that has become overblown, over-written and massively over-long.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: [Director] Villeneuve never strikes the moral terror that has distinguished his best films. . .Blade Runner's awesomeness is gone.
reviews.author: Armond White

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a worthy - and beautiful - follow-up.
reviews.author: Tom Shone

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve & co. have constructed a follow-up of such satisfyingly detailed echoes, while still managing to retain an identity unique from the shadow under which it thrives. This might be Blade Runner 2049's greatest achievement.
reviews.author: Leonardo Faierman

reviews.text: Visually, this dying future world is immersively hellish. Intellectually, though, its ideas haven't kept up with the rapidly evolving science-fictional conversation.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: More sequel than sequel.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: Spectacular enough to win over new generations of viewers, yet deep enough to reassure diehard fans that their cherished memories haven't been reduced to tradable synthetic implants.
reviews.author: Mark Kermode

reviews.text: The film is mesmerizing to behold. (Full Content Review for Parents - Violence, Profanity, Nudity, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: Though the film dazzles us with its hauntingly beautiful images, it disappoints with its lack of substance.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: From the grayed-out countrysides over which the sky has closed like a lid; to the drizzly neon decadence of Los Angeles; to the Ozymandian wreckage of Las Vegas-the film is a visual splendor of the first order.
reviews.author: Christopher Orr

reviews.text: In any futuristic film, it always seems as if the acting takes a backseat to its visual features. In "Blade Runner 2049," Ryan Gosling offers up his most complex and alluring work since "Drive."
reviews.author: Clayton Davis

reviews.text: . . . a big, bleak, bold, bad-ass beauty of an adventure.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: It's a must-see for fans of the 1982 original film, but there will be heated debates to come between its advocates and its critics.
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: It does something sci-fi movies rarely do anymore, and sequels do even less: it shows us things we've never seen.
reviews.author: Jason Bailey

reviews.text: Gosling and Ford are solid performers but it is Ana de Armas whose star is born.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: There's no conceivable way that a Blade Runner sequel could be more satisfying to anyone who loves its predecessor.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: A meditative and moving film, sumptuously photographed by legendary cinematographer Roger Deakins in the finest and most astonishing work of his career.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: So much is absolutely spellbinding, particularly the visuals and sound. Many scenes are hauntingly, eerily still.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: "It's too bad she won't live" - as James Edward Olmos' cop says at the end of the original - but it seems that Scott's punk-noir darling has.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: Here, the heroes, villains and themes and even the cyberpunk noir aesthetic feel familiar, but what this lacks in story originality, director Denis Villeneuve makes up in style.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: [2049] is long, laborious (in a good way) and lovingly detailed. It's also visually and aurally spectacular.
reviews.author: Michael Heaton

reviews.text: For fans of the original, this should be enough to satisfy your soul (and nostalgia). For a new generation of viewers, the deliberate pacing will be a challenge, and in the end it's Deakins' framing, perspective and wondrous lighting that will carry them.
reviews.author: Kong Rithdee

reviews.text: What could have been another exercise in nostalgia instead took on a surprisingly defiant, idiosyncratic life of its own. It isn't perfect, but it's well worth your time.
reviews.author: Melissa Leon

reviews.text: Where the original was a 1940's detective story set in the near future, this uses Hollywood's biblical Roman epics as a template and is built with a similar scope, weight and spiritual core.
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: A film that possesses finesse in its visual discourse, a language that goes from dream to opiate travel, from dream to malice of an imagined situation in the head of a first time dreamer. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: Blade Runner's world is grotty, grey, crowded and retrofitted. This future doesn't jettison the past. It cannibalizes it, from ancient ziggurats to Art Deco glamour.
reviews.author: Alison Gillmor

reviews.text: From the get-go, Villeneuve paints Blade Runner 2049 in his unique style. This is a rare, unhurried, futuristic film, much like Villeneuve's Arrival - philosophical and meditative.
reviews.author: Udita Jhunjhunwala

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 stands tall as one of the finest science fiction films of the last decade, even if it falls just short of perfection.
reviews.author: Hayden Mears

reviews.text: It avoids strip-mining the original or recycling old ideas, and there aren't any contrived twists.
reviews.author: Peter Lawrence Kane

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049, on the other hand, manages to be prettier but far more prosaic.
reviews.author: Alison Willmore

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 will be remembered and studied, but best of all, will influence future filmmakers. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio López Aguirre

reviews.text: The rare sequel that truly merits its existence, updating and expanding the themes of the 1982 original to bring them from the 20th century into the 21st.
reviews.author: Kate Taylor

reviews.text: A wondrous work of filmmaking, Blade Runner 2049 is something you can get lost inside for darn near three hours. Much like Villeneuve's Oscar-nominated work on Arrival, it's visceral, often spellbinding, even brilliant at times.
reviews.author: Christopher Lawrence

reviews.text: Even if Blade Runner 2049 is technically a riff on a previous director's vision, it is a piece of filmmaking that towers above its peers.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: Just as Scott did in the original film, Villeneuve adopts an unhurried pace and some may find the plot rather too dense and convoluted. Probably it will take more than one viewing to make complete sense of it.
reviews.author: David Stratton

reviews.text: It took 35 years for a sequel to be made to Blade Runner. But it's a great movie sequel that dishonors no one -- least of all the audience.
reviews.author: Jeff Simon

reviews.text: As the plot twists and turns, the settings and gadgets create a retro vision of the future that's almost unnervingly recognisable as where we live right now.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: Villeneuve and cinematographer Roger Deakins give us staggering new visions of the future, ones that confound and trance and mystify in Blade Runner 2049 even while making rich cinematic senses.
reviews.author: Bob Mondello

reviews.text: A visual display of sordid elegance and sublime beauty of dystopian nature. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge (JJ) Negrete

reviews.text: Liberation doesn't have quite the same effect when it's done by white people, for other white people.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: Methodical and sad, it's a film with plenty of mood but little emotion, well made but frigid.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: As melancholy and bleak as Blade Runner 2049 is, when it ends, you want to see it over again, just to ease back into that mood pocket and savor its dark delicacies.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: This film is everything that cinema should be, both in terms of its plot and its audiovisual proposal, from beginning to end. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Oswaldo Betancourt Lozano

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is heavy with portentous and pretentious hoo-ha.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: In many ways Blade Runner 2049 is a perfect sequel. Consider that a warning.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: With the appearance of Harrison Ford, I notice that the mediocre bar is raised a little. But he's late in a film that seems eternal to me. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Boyero

reviews.text: Visually stunning and soaked in atmosphere.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: ... fans of the original should not be disappointed. With questions of human worth, value, choice, and sacrifice, it's what big sci-fi should be: holding onto humanity in the shadow of technology.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a fantastic movie with bold ideas, visually stunning direction, and powerful performances. But underneath it all lies a Hollywood reboot.
reviews.author: Matthew Razak

reviews.text: Despite all the overlaps, this is not a simulacrum of a Ridley Scott film. It is unmistakably a Denis Villeneuve film, inviting us to tumble, tense with anticipation, into his doomy clutches.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: There's a frisson in seeing fecundity exalted in a world bent on selling pleasure-sex.
reviews.author: Matthew Lickona

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 has been made with impeccable craftsmanship and taste, yet the film is so terrified of disreputability that it renders itself dead from the waist down, unable to derive pleasure even from a theoretically kinky robot three-way.
reviews.author: Chuck Bowen

reviews.text: Impressive and dazzling and takes nothing away from the iconic original.
reviews.author: Victoria Alexander

reviews.text: When Leto uttered the line "You do not know what pain is yet," I wondered if it had been re-purposed from Hellraiser.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: While [BLADE RUNNER 2049] succeeds in more complex world building, it doesn't achieve a depth of story that couldn't have been told in half the running time.
reviews.author: Rubin Safaya

reviews.text: The latest Denis Villeneuve achievement, Blade Runner 2049 is the rare sequel that both pushes the franchise to challenging new places and serves as a natural extension of what's come before.
reviews.author: Robert Yaniz, Jr.

reviews.text: A film, like the replicants who populate it, that makes a perfectly compelling case for its own existence.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: Plays like a bloated director's cut.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is breathtakingly dull...It barely has enough story to cover a 90-minute film let alone one that runs 164...It's punishingly slow, the performances are sullen and dour; nobody seems interested in being there...the film is a visual bore.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: Has some significant problems - but is also crammed with dazzling moments.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: A motion picture of grand aims and elevated altitudes, "Blade Runner 2049" challenges in the best way, as emotionally resounding as it is visually remarkable.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: It takes on the themes and universe set forth in the original and builds on them, and manages to live up to the massive expectations that greet it. This is no replicant, it's the real deal.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: With this, there can be little doubt that Denis Villeneuve is one of the greatest science-fiction filmmakers ever - right up there with Kubrick, Fritz Lang, and Nolan.
reviews.author: Rohan Naahar

reviews.text: Is it blasphemy to suggest that Blade Runner 2049 is just okay and doesn't suck?
reviews.author: Luke Y. Thompson

reviews.text: Barely fresh. At 2:43 it's too long. Director Dennis Villeneuve is too in love with his effects and drags out his movie by half an hour. Not Blade Runner but blade crawler.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: I admire the hard work that went into this film by a team of people who are devotees of the original and strove to do it justice. Fans and admirers will weigh in en masse, I'm sure...but I found Blade Runner 2049 long and boring.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: ...a rich, thought-provoking continuation that benefits from the passage of time.
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: After the movie's sometimes taxing, 164-minute running time, I found that other more immediately pressing needs required attention.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: To summarise, treat yourself this week with a trip to 2049. You may return with more questions than before you went in, but at least it'll make you think.
reviews.author: Shyama Krishna Kumar

reviews.text: I enjoyed this infinitely more than the original and I'm 100 per cent behind the thinking that Denis Villeneuve is the greatest filmmaker alive.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: A film that is pure escape, pure delight, a nighttime movie tour through the memory and the cinematics. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Martínez

reviews.text: As to the those big questions ... Blade Runner 2049 is conclusive about most things, but also asserts its own set of questions. And that's not a spoiler.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: While it's part of the nostalgia-courting blockbuster machine currently dominating mainstream cinema, it isn't interested in simply being a well-made rehash.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: Against all the odds, Blade Runner 2049 is a majestic, uncompromising science-fiction epic that stands shoulder to shoulder with its predecessor as a film of wondrous images and thought-provoking reflections on what it means to be human.
reviews.author: Charlotte Heathcote

reviews.text: Everything is at full strength, and while it is by no means an action film, it is thrilling.
reviews.author: Jonathan Roberts

reviews.text: Directed with more style than substance by Denis Villeneuve, Blade Runner 2049 improves upon the original film, even if it cannot capture what made it so special.
reviews.author: Alan Zilberman

reviews.text: "Blade Runner 2049"... is a film to savor and mull over.
reviews.author: Beth Accomando

reviews.text: With more violence than the first film and a stronger emphasis on sex, this also lacks the underlying philosophical conundrums that made Blade Runner so lastingly powerful.
reviews.author: David 'Mad Dog' Bradley

reviews.text: ... proof of how a sequel can be just as good as the original movie, even if released decades apart.
reviews.author: Julia Alexander

reviews.text: The greatness of a film, it is known, is not measured by its budget, its duration or the prestige of its creators but by the artistic discoveries and, in this sense, Blade Runner 2049 intends more than it finally obtains. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Diego Batlle

reviews.text: ... profound without being pretentious... [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: José Felipe Coria

reviews.text: The look of Blade Runner 2049 tops the dark chaos of Blade Runner. Roger Deakins' cinematography and Dennis Gassner's production design are beyond stunning. It's hard to imagine anyone topping them for the Oscar.
reviews.author: Maria Sciullo

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049, then, is undoubtedly the most gorgeous thing to come out of a major studio in some time.
reviews.author: Dom Sinacola

reviews.text: There's more to be said, and both Blade Runner films create a distinct world and people it, so to speak, with characters you won't soon forget.
reviews.author: Edward Johnson-Ott

reviews.text: Technically almost perfect, but forced and solemn in excess. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yago García

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is Gosling's, and while the movie is a bit bloated, it's both a worthy successor to the original and a chilling meditation on what it means to be human.
reviews.author: Garrett Schaffel

reviews.text: Harrison Ford, for his part, is nothing less than a revelation.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a stunner through and through, a film that works both as a continuation to an all-time classic and as a superior cinematic experience in its own right.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: When the script - FINALLY - gets around to Deckard, Ford props up the proceedings with some signs of life - but that energy is fleeting.
reviews.author: Dana Barbuto

reviews.text: So let's not call Blade Runner 2049 a sequel. Call it the spiritual successor to one of the greatest science-fiction stories ever told. And it lives up to that billing.
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: Admiration for Blade Runner 2049 begins with ... the movie's world ... Unfortunately, admiration for this semi-spinoff/semi-sequel ... also ends with its world.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 really does look the part. The film is lovingly detailed, astonishingly lit and scored and designed in a way that manages to be both meticulous and pleasantly sparse.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Enigmatic, continually intriguing, and at its heart, a noir film.
reviews.author: Tony Stamp

reviews.text: It's indeed a shame that Blade Runner 2049 doesn't offer up enough food for thought to go with its visual brilliance.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: I didn't like Blade Runner 2049 very much in the hours after first watching it. I didn't like the way it resolved the previous film's storylines--how stolid it was in its exposition and how eager it seemed to talk about what was on its mind.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: The misandry-prone geek bros won't know what hit them.
reviews.author: Richard von Busack

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is the sequel we didn't need, a film that mimics the original's style, but falls short of capturing its danger and romance.
reviews.author: Jason Di Rosso

reviews.text: Director Denis Villeneuve and crew have lovingly embraced the weird, neo noir, sci-fi vibe of Ridley Scott's Blade Runner from 1982 and extended its bleak conception of the future to the mid-21st century.
reviews.author: Clint O'Connor

reviews.text: 2049 is the ultimate successor to Blade Runner. It's the full realization of what Ridley Scott started building in 1982.
reviews.author: Neil Miller

reviews.text: By picking up the narrative baton that original Blade Runner director Scott carried for so long, Villeneuve immerses us in the hopeful reawakening to a future that beckons us to rush forward without fear.
reviews.author: tt stern-enzi

reviews.text: It's Villeneuve's best picture to date, offering artful reverence to "Blade Runner" without altering its gorgeous, forbidding atmosphere and core sci-fi/noir appeal.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Director Denis Villeneuve's visual stunner deftly expands the 'Blade Runner' universe.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is one of the brainiest films to come out of Hollywood in a long while, asking more questions about the meaning of life than it answers.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 may be breathtaking cinema, but it isn't great storytelling.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: Yet despite Ryan Gosling, a striking visual template and Harrison Ford reprising the role he played in the 1982 sci-fi classic, glitches mar this undeniably ambitious but drawn-out exercise.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: Ford doesn't enliven the film for nostalgic reasons. He brings fierce, potent energy to the role, capturing Deckard's suspicion of K, protectiveness about his past, and will to survive. In a career of iconic roles, this is among his best.
reviews.author: Caryn James

reviews.text: Could Villeneuve match, let alone surpass, that original? Well, the answer is a resounding yes. ... Blade Runner 2049 is visually stunning, emotionally stimulating and -- at times -- emotionally devastating.
reviews.author: Rob Carnevale

reviews.text: In the pantheon of classic science-fiction films, if Blade Runner is No. 1, as some would argue, there's an argument that Blade Runner 2049 just might be 1A.
reviews.author: Michael Smith

reviews.text: It never properly creates its own world, the drama is plodding, and every character is a tiresome type.
reviews.author: Deborah Ross

reviews.text: Barely fresh. 163 minutes of post apocalyptic eye candy and sci-fi sound and fury signifying not much.
reviews.author: James Verniere

reviews.text: The film is no less sombre than its predecessor, and the glacial pace at which the characters walk and talk indicates that they know this full well. But the ideas aren't complex enough to justify the time spent unpicking them.
reviews.author: Ryan Gilbey

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 gives us a hyper-realized aesthetic and tries to convince us that it has given us a world.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: It could stand to have as much clarity afforded to its narrative and thematics as to its visuals.
reviews.author: Alissa Wilkinson

reviews.text: Fans of Ridley Scott's landmark 1982 dystopian noir drama Blade Runner will be thrilled to find that director Denis Villeneuve has soaked his follow-up, Blade Runner 2049, in as much grime-and-neon atmosphere as the original.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: Ryan Gosling's lead performance is actually better than Harrison Ford's was in the 1982 film, which isn't a knock on Ford but rather a testament to his successor's gifts.
reviews.author: Bernard Boo

reviews.text: The initial trepidation surrounding Blade Runner 2049 should be replaced by relief and exhilaration, as it's now clear that Villeneuve was the right man to helm such a risky project.
reviews.author: J.R. Kinnard

reviews.text: See 2049 on the biggest screen you can possibly find. Let the stunning visuals overwhelm you -- Villeneuve is a brilliant craftsman.
reviews.author: Joe Gross

reviews.text: It's a film that's short of soul, and most of the original thinking was already done in Blade Runner 1, but it delivers a powerful impact in other ways. See it on an Imax screen if you can.
reviews.author: Adam Sweeting

reviews.text: Director Denis Villeneuve, who earned his sci-fi bona fides with Arrival, successfully replicates the cold austerity Ridley Scott brought to Blade Runner.
reviews.author: J. R. Jones

reviews.text: A visually dazzling follow-up to one of science fiction's most iconic films.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: "Blade Runner 2049" is not just a movie but an event. Don't be the only human on your block not to see it.
reviews.author: Calvin Wilson

reviews.text: Villeneuve and company have cast a powerful and disturbing visual spell, thrusting us into a world compelling enough to get lost in.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: Replicant hunter uncovers a conspiracy that could change the world in an ambitious, uncompromising sci-fi adventure.
reviews.author: Daniel Eagan

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is chockablock with rich philosophical questions of what it means to be human and where the line between human and machine blurs into an unrecognizable haze.
reviews.author: Marc Savlov

reviews.text: An improvement on the original-a thoughtful, visually striking, emotionally satisfying continuation of Scott's celebrated but rather muddled film.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: ... a visual delight.
reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hickman

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a towering sequel to the science fiction classic. It is visually spellbinding, a dark odyssey that flirts with greatness.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is not only among the year's best films, but arguably one of the best sequels ever issued. Somewhere, Avatar's James Cameron is watching closely and scribbling notes.
reviews.author: Kim Hughes

reviews.text: [A] miraculous, riveting cinematic achievement that does the impossible -- living up to the original film and even at times surpassing it.
reviews.author: Mark Hughes

reviews.text: A movie for people who miss the voice-over narration. It turns poetry into prose.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: While Blade Runner 2049 may not end up being the classic the original is, in some ways it's as good of a sequel as you could ask for.
reviews.author: Britton Peele

reviews.text: Somewhere in "Blade Runner 2049" is a terrific 100-minute movie struggling to get out.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: Moody, methodical and meticulous, with stunning visuals, strong performances and a sci-fi story that's more ponderous than thrilling.
reviews.author: Josh Bell

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 embraces the enormous shadow cast by Blade Runner 1982 by crafting a vast immersion in scale and vision.
reviews.author: Simon Foster

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is so good, I'd be happy for Denis to tempt fate and make another.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: A breathtaking sequel to the futuristic classic Blade Runner, the film soars on the wings of its stunning visuals and moody score. It's stunning!
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: Like the 20-foot-tall ballerina holograms pirouetting through its decrepit Los Angeles streets, "Blade Runner 2049" is hauntingly beautiful, technologically stunning and low on substance.
reviews.author: Sara Stewart

reviews.text: An ambitious movie that deepens on topics of the first film, such as identity and artificial intelligence. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Pablo O. Scholz

reviews.text: ...a work that pays homage to its forebear while simultaneously using that material to push us into new and confronting places...
reviews.author: Travis Johnson

reviews.text: Villeneuve has taken the double-edged sword of the update and created a Blade Runner 2049 worthy of honouring its ancestor, while bringing it appropriately into the mid-21st Century.
reviews.author: Sarah Watt

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is, hands-down, the greatest sequel in the history of cinema.
reviews.author: Randy Shulman

reviews.text: In terms of the imaginative ways it expands on the themes of the first movie, it is the rare sequel that is at least the equal of its iconic original.
reviews.author: Soren Andersen

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 honors the original in many ways - some small and some large - but it's not a soft reboot. It's a new story with new ideas and new purpose.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Magnificently imagined, stunningly designed, and one of the best of the year.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: In the masterful hands of director Denis Villeneuve, the dystopian story does more than justify its existence, it cements itself as one of the best films of 2017 and Villeneuve as one of the most exciting directors of today.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: The tone? The giant scope? The philosophical underbelly? A compelling story? ... [T]he sequel lives up to its predecessor in all these ways and manages to stand on its own.
reviews.author: Vivian Kane

reviews.text: Despite its blockbuster trappings, this Blade Runner is as much an art movie as the first one: slow, idea-driven, and often emotionally remote.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: Not since the great Mad Max: Fury Road has a game-changing conceptual vision landed on the big screen so fully and forcefully realised.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: The script contains enough core truths and grand philosophical concepts that no spoiler could touch them, such as the co-dependence of slavery and freedom, or the paradoxical way the future echoes and restates the past.
reviews.author: John Wenzel

reviews.text: This might be heresy, but I'll argue Villeneuve's sequel is a deeper and more engaging work than its progenitor, less concerned with action beats than with ideas, themes and character.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: One of those films where the sum of the best parts does give a huge cinematographic work. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro G. Calvo

reviews.text: It catches you and knows how to go further with what was proposed in the first installment, also proposing an enticing scenario for a possible third installment. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: "Blade Runner 2049" explodes on the silver screen as a stunning achievement...
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: ... in Blade Runner 2049, Villeneuve has not just lived up to lofty expectations, but surpassed them entirely.
reviews.author: Stuart McGurk

reviews.text: ... a superb action thriller, and a saddening parable about human existence and identity.
reviews.author: Alan Corr

reviews.text: If you don't value the artistry of Blade Runner 2049, you might not be human.
reviews.author: Cameron Meier

reviews.text: A strange and beautiful beast indeed, Blade Runner 2049 is a science-fiction epic for adults, somehow released in 2017...Blade Runner 2049 dreams big.
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: Visually stunning and ambitious sequel to the 1982 film has a cool performance from Ryan Gosling but is blissfully helped by its original star Harrison Ford, even if the two hour and 44 minute running time could definitely use some editing.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: It's a massive, epic piece of science fiction that keeps the audience engaged, entertained and stunned.
reviews.author: Jack Giroux

reviews.text: There are no new ideas here, poignancy achieved by rehashing moments of the original film with dollops lifted from Spielberg's "A.I." and Spike Jonze's "Her."
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: ...Blade Runner 2049 arrives at our doorsteps clocking in at 2 hours and 44 minutes. I dare say that very few of its moments are wasted, and, yes, it has been worth the wait.
reviews.author: Elias Savada

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 an enthralling science fiction tour de force that will only get better and more emotionally invigorating with each additional viewing.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is the rare sequel that surpasses a classic.
reviews.author: Matt Goldberg

reviews.text: Really pretty and intermittently poses interesting questions about where exactly the nature of humanity lies but at the expense of a compelling plot.
reviews.author: Joshua Starnes

reviews.text: Yes, this is a movie that takes itself very seriously, but it saves itself by taking its subject even more seriously.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: Fully fleshed out with a fierce imagination and sharp good looks, it doesn't matter if Blade Runner 2049 is a replica of an original model - it's even better than the real thing.
reviews.author: Ali Gray

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is excellent. Hampton Fancher and Michael Green's script continues to push the themes and questions of the original and finds a new angle from which to do so.
reviews.author: Jonathan Hatfull

reviews.text: We end up with an intoxicating, brain-melting yarn that, for all its pleasures, has ideas a little above its station. It's not Kafka. Then again it doesn't need to be.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: A brilliant new sci-fi benchmark, an epic movie yardstick against which future science fiction flicks will be compared and measured--it's the 2001 of 2017.
reviews.author: Neil Pond

reviews.text: What a remarkable film this is...
reviews.author: Brian Viner

reviews.text: Villeneuve crafts a movie both cerebral and sensuous, as puzzling and visually striking as its predecessor. The experience should be likewise revered by next generations.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: This worthy sequel is a feast for the eyes and ears. The heart? Not so much.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: For a bleak dystopian future, it sure is a beautiful place to visit.
reviews.author: Ethan Sacks

reviews.text: Get ready to see the perfect chill Gosling performance.
reviews.author: Jason Guerrasio

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 not only succeeds at feeling like a necessary franchise revival, it also makes for a captivating standalone work of science-fiction.
reviews.author: Sandy Schaefer

reviews.text: The strength of "Blade Runner 2049" lies in its humanity. For a movie dealing mostly with artificial life, the film touches on such issues as memory, freedom of choice and the rights of individuals.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: Masterful in its craft and elegant in its message, it doesn't simply replicate the themes and ideas of the first film, but builds on them in ways that are both authentic and inventive.
reviews.author: Nikki Baughan

reviews.text: This is really Villeneuve's film: he surpasses even his own 2016 sci-fi Arrival with this stunning visual masterpiece.
reviews.author: James Mottram

reviews.text: The best cyberpunk film since the original Matrix, and the best big-budget American science fiction film in years.
reviews.author: Dan Schindel

reviews.text: A big disappointment. All the pretty vistas in the world can't enliven this protracted futuro-slog.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: An artistic as well as a philosophical triumph ...
reviews.author: Andrew Collins

reviews.text: An extraordinary experience that will leave you open-mouthed with wonder. It deserves to be seen on the biggest screen possible.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: In terms of a sequel besting the original, Blade Runner 2049 is not a unicorn. But it is a breathtaking, non-comformist achievement.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: There is a something to think about here, a fair amount to feel and even more to see.
reviews.author: A.O. Scott

reviews.text: While Blade Runner 2049 is always something to look at, an overly elaborate script and some other bad habits common to today's sequel machinery - such as glaring product placement - have broken the Blade Runner spell.
reviews.author: Jake Coyle

reviews.text: I don't want to ruin a single surprise in this remarkable film.
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: One of the most deeply philosophical and challenging sci-fi films of all time.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve succeeds in making 2049 feel distinct from Ridley Scott's film without sacrificing aspects that made the original so powerful.
reviews.author: Benjamin Rabinovich

reviews.text: The special effects are impeccable, and include sequences that blur the line, evocatively, between what's real and unreal.
reviews.author: Michael O'Sullivan

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 does what very few sequels can accomplish: it deepens our appreciation of its predecessor, while carving out its own niche in the spaces of our own imaginations. And the visuals it paints are in a word: breathtaking.
reviews.author: Mark Daniell

reviews.text: Everything wrong with sequels. There's not one original, awe inspiring moment in this film. It's cold, emotionally inert, uninspired and ultimately an empty experience.
reviews.author: Michelle Alexandria

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is bold, mesmerizing, and grandiose.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: ... a moody, broody visual feast that taps into our unease about the advent of artificial intelligence.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Less a generational iteration from its precursor than an evolutionary leap.
reviews.author: Chris Klimek

reviews.text: This film is stop-and-point stunning. It is not without problems, however.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: If Blade Runner gave us the world, Blade Runner 2049 has come to fill in the universe.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: One of the best movies of the year.
reviews.author: Jordan Hoffman

reviews.text: The brilliance of Blade Runner 2049 is that it makes the questions worth asking, positioning them in a menacing universe that's nevertheless a joy to revisit.
reviews.author: Eric Kohn

reviews.text: The film belongs to [Ryan] Gosling. He evokes the classic detective heroes of cinema, hiding his need for connection just beneath a hard surface.
reviews.author: Victoria Luxford

reviews.text: This new Blade Runner dazzles the audience with plenty of staggering sights.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: While this might be a bold statement to make, I do believe that Blade Runner 2049 is better than the original.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: Not quite a classic, but this smart and visually stunning sequel will still be poured over by fans for years to come. If this was a poisoned chalice, Villeneuve has grabbed it with both hands.
reviews.author: Andy Lea

reviews.text: A meticulously made visual wonder that should put any other filmmaker dabbling in sci-fi futurism on notice.
reviews.author: Dave Schilling

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a triumph. As good as you want to be, and better than you could have expected.
reviews.author: Jon Lyus

reviews.text: It's hard to make a case against reboots and long-delayed sequels when an exception to the rule like Blade Runner 2049 comes along. No cynical cash-grab or by-the-numbers repeat, this sequel manages to go deeper on the ideas from the first film.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 offers a stunning, immersive and fascinating journey through a strange and familiar world.
reviews.author: Rosie Fletcher

reviews.text: Careful, dutiful, and beautiful, Blade Runner 2049 cannot achieve the sublime slipperiness of Scott's masterpiece. Whether it even needs to is up to you.
reviews.author: Bilge Ebiri

reviews.text: It may seem premature to ascribe the word 'masterpiece' to a legacyquel of a heady sci-fi head-scratcher from the '80s, but its audacity and formal perfection - not to mention its thematic weight - leave no other alternative.
reviews.author: Clint Worthington

reviews.text: Forty years after his death, people still argue over which Elvis, the slim young Adonis or the portly middle aged crooner, was better. Forty years from now, people may be having that debate about these Blade Runners.
reviews.author: Matthew Norman

reviews.text: As the break between installments would suggest, it's a furthering of not just the original story but the original world, and that's quite an accomplishment.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: Rather than being overly beholden to its predecessor it immediately, but subtly, expands the world, while unraveling its mysterious and meandering plot in a surprising and refreshingly forthright manner.
reviews.author: Gregory Wakeman

reviews.text: It organically expands and grows what came before. It's a deep, rich, smart film that's visually awesome and full of great sci-fi concepts, and one that was well worth the 35-year wait.
reviews.author: Scott Collura

reviews.text: Will cinematographer Roger Deakins, having been nominated for an Academy Award 13 times, finally receive a damn Oscar? Yes. I hope it's yes. It should be "yes."
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 supersedes its predecessor in a number of ways, and is not only a brilliant sci-fi movie, but one of the best movies of the year.
reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

reviews.text: At the helm and in complete command of his movie with dark, ambient magic, Denis Villeneuve crafts a mysterious noir thriller the pushes existential boundaries, and nails the essence of the "Blade Runner" spirit.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: Villeneuve's dazzling sequel is on its own march to screen legend. Gosling and Ford are double dynamite in a mesmerizing mindbender that asks new questions meant to tantalize, provoke and keep us up nights. Would you have it any other way?
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: Like The Godfather Part II, it's a sequel to a very celebrated film which may actually be better than the original.
reviews.author: Geoffrey Macnab

reviews.text: A ravishing visual colossus, "Blade Runner 2049" more than lives up to its predecessor's legacy as a groundbreaking mixture of sound, images and mood.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: We've grown so used to lowest-common-denominator blockbuster cinema that it's almost shocking to watch a big science fiction movie, featuring these kinds of stars, swinging for the fences in this way.
reviews.author: Bryan Bishop

reviews.text: Even when its emotions risk running as cool as its palette, 2049 reaches for, and finds, something remarkable: the elevation of mainstream moviemaking to high art.
reviews.author: Leah Greenblatt

reviews.text: It just has to be experienced on the biggest screen possible. Blade Runner 2049 is a narcotic spectacle of eerie and pitiless vastness, by turns satirical, tragic and romantic.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Villeneuve's film is a direct continuation in every respect; it's difficult to imagine anyone - even Ridley Scott - making a better Blade Runner sequel.
reviews.author: Jordan Farley

reviews.text: Visually immaculate, swirling with themes as heart-rending as they are mind-twisting, 2049 is, without doubt, a good year. And one of 2017's best.
reviews.author: Dan Jolin

reviews.text: Better than the original.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: One of the most spectacular, provocative, profound and spiritually staggering blockbusters of our time.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: A voluptuous mood bath that's impressively sustained from beginning to end.
reviews.author: Todd McCarthy

reviews.text: A visually breathtaking, long-fuse action movie whose unconventional thrills could be described as many things - from tantalizing to tedious - but never "artificially intelligent."
reviews.author: Peter Debruge

reviews.text: I imagine most audiences will like the film ... I thought it was okay.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Super-stylish and deeply human - even with androids and holograms around - the spectacular follow-up takes the detective story of the first film and turns it into a grand mythology of identity, memory, creation and revolution.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: The long-awaited Blade Runner 2049 delivers on the promise of the world of Blade Runner spending more time and visiting more corners of the now even more distant future.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: It looks great and boasts solid performances from an underused cast, but (like the original) it's a triumph of style over substance.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: A breathtaking, mind-bending cinematic experience.
reviews.author: Eric Eisenberg

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 is a gorgeous return to a wearisome world.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: Blade Runner 2049 triumphs in many of the same ways as its predecessor -- even more so -- but also suffers from some of the same issues that plagued the original.
reviews.author: Don Kaye

reviews.text: A breathtaking return to the awe-inspiring and deeply troubled world of Blade Runner.
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: Immersing you in a complete wow, Blade Runner 2049 is the thinking person's sci-fi event of the year.
reviews.author: Joshua Rothkopf

synopsis: Officer K (Ryan Gosling), a new blade runner for the Los Angeles Police Department, unearths a long-buried secret that has the potential to plunge what's left of society into chaos. His discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard (Harrison Ford), a former blade runner who's been missing for 30 years.
